page.title: 20LOCAL FAMILIES & PLACENAMES
page.content: When we looked at the old census lists of 1861 we were surprised at the number of peoples surnames that were the same as the names of children who are at our School now. In the Parish Church of Holy Trinity at Stockton there are many memorials to the Agar family.Charles Agar inherited Stockton Hall in 1910. Records show that a Thomas Agar was a landowner in Stockton in 1583.The Pub at Warthill is known as the Agar Arms. Stockton has some roads named after notable historic local characters.There is De Mauley Place named after the Lord of the Manor in 1303.Chaumont Way remembers Gaceus de Chaumont who was Lord Mayor of York in 1256 and was a landowner in Stockton. Finally, there is a road named Marmian Drive, which recalls Maud Marmian who owned the land in the village in 1347.
